main event: On 20 November 1953, seven individuals driving near Marietta, Ohio, sighted a circular metallic object emitting a reddish-orange glow, traveling at an estimated speed of 1,000 miles per hour and at an estimated altitude of 1,500 feet.
interesting points: The object was approximately 40 to 50 feet in diameter and was not considered a conventional aircraft by the witnesses.
One of the individuals reported the incident to a Federal Bureau of Investigation assistant agent, who recommended contacting the Office of Special Investigations at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
The sighting lasted approximately a third of a minute, and the witnesses were certain that it was not a conventional aircraft.
The report was verbally coordinated with Lockbourne Air Force Base, Deputy Director of Operations, Ohio Air Division with no further investigative action contemplated.
The report indicates that physical evidence was present.
sighted object: circular metallic object emitting a reddish-orange glow
